GE.evidence: “From July 26 to August 1, 2023, Irakli Garibashvili, Prime Minister of Georgia, attended the opening ceremony of the 31st Chengdu FISU World University Games in China…The two sides decided to elevate bilateral relations to a strategic partnership.” http://ge.china-embassy.gov.cn/eng/xwdt/202308/t20230807_11123383.htm

AZ.evidence: China and Azerbaijan have upgraded bilateral relations to a strategic partnership, which is a new positioning and a new starting point, Chinese President Xi Jinping said when meeting with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev ahead of the 24th Meeting of the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO). (2024)

UZ.evidence:
The President of the Republic of Uzbekistan, Shavkat Mirziyoyev, and the President of the People’s Republic of China, Xi Jinping, signed a Joint Statement and adopted a Program of Comprehensive Strategic Partnership in a New Era between the Republic of Uzbekistan and the People’s Republic of China for 2023-2027.
https://president.uz/en/lists/view/6345

Uzbekistan is ready to learn from China's experience in poverty alleviation, deepen cooperation in various fields, strengthen people-to-people and cultural exchanges, and actively implement the Global Development Initiative, the Global Security Initiative, and the Global Civilization Initiative, further elevating Uzbekistan-China comprehensive strategic partnership to a new level.
https://www.mfa.gov.cn/mfa_eng/zxxx_662805/202305/t20230521_11080865.html

The Leaders of Uzbekistan and China Opt for Further Strengthening of Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.
https://president.uz/en/lists/view/4962
UZ.answerer: Answered by Farkhod Tolipov, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

TJ.evidence:
President Xi Jinping pointed out that since China and Tajikistan established diplomatic relations, the bilateral relationship has achieved leapfrog development from one of good-neighborliness to a strategic partnership and then to a comprehensive strategic partnership.
http://ir.china-embassy.gov.cn/eng/zyxw/202305/t20230521_11080808.htm

In 2013, the People's Republic of China and the Republic of Tajikistan officially established a strategic partnership and made steady progress in all areas of cooperation.

https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/eng/gjhdq_665435/2675_665437/3235_664362/3236_664364/200809/t20080905_560700.html

KG.evidence: On the morning of May 18, 2023, President Xi Jinping held talks in Xi'an with President Sadyr Zhaparov of Kyrgyzstan, who was in China for the China-Central Asia Summit and a state visit. The two heads of state announced the elevation of China-Kyrgyzstan relations to a comprehensive strategic partnership for a new era.

MN.evidence:
"http://np.china-embassy.gov.cn/eng/News/201408/t20140822_1584996.htm                                           The PRC and Mongolia upgraded ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership in 2014.                                             https://english.news.cn/20231019/be2663e770ec430aacff01db139af04d/c.html 
Chinese President Xi Jinping called for greater development of China-Mongolia comprehensive strategic partnership in the new era to deliver more benefits to the two peoples. As good brothers, good neighbors and good partners, China and Mongolia should continue to walk hand in hand, Xi said when meeting with Mongolian President Ukhnaa Khurelsukh in Beijing on Thursday. 

https://news.cgtn.com/news/2023-10-19/Xi-meets-Mongolian-president-1o1uVlqjdWo/index.html                      
https://thediplomaticinsight.com/china-mongolia-comprehensive-strategic-partnership/ 
Beijing, 29 November 2022 (TDI): Chinese President, Xi Jinping met with President Ukhnaagiin Khurelsukh of Mongolia on his state visit to China.China is prepared to cooperate with Mongolia to create a society with a shared future. Together, the two nations may support the stable, long-term growth of the China-Mongolia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership."

CR.evidence:
"Diplomatic relations between Costa Rica and China were elevated to the category of strategic partnership after the visit of the then President of the Republic, Luis Guillermo Solís, to China in January 2015. Therefore, this indicator deserves a “yes” response.”

"

PE.evidence: Since April 2013, Peru achieved the “Comprehensive Strategic Partnership” qualification with China. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.

BD.evidence: PRC signed a "Strategic Partnership" agreement with Bangladesh in 2016 to implement BRI projects worth around US $27 billion for 26 projects covering Chinese investment in Bangladesh in sectors such as the Belt and Road Initiative, capacity cooperation, telecommunications, energy, electricity, etc. On December 31, 2023, Yao Wen, Ambassador of China to Bangladesh, mentioned in a statement that "China and Bangladesh have jointly carried forward our Strategic Partnership of Cooperation this year".
BD.note: China has invested close to $26 billion in Bangladesh between 2016 and 2022. In 2023 alone, China spent approximately $800 million in Bangladesh.

PT.evidence: The Strategic Partnership was established in 2005. It was reinforced in 2018, alongside Xi Jinping's official visit to Portugal, with the signature of 17 cooperation agreements and a joint declaration. In 2018, an MoU was signed regarding the Belt and Road Initiative. In 2019, it was upgraded to a Strategic Dialogue alongside the Visit of the President of the Portuguese Republic to China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PT.note: For other relevant historical dimensions particularly regarding Macau in the bilateral relationship see https://portaldiplomatico.mne.gov.pt/relacoesbilaterais/paises-geral/republica-popular-da-china
PT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RO.evidence: The relation is that of "special partnership". When Romanian officials like the current Minister of Labor make statements in meetings with PRC representatives about "strategic partnerships" (link), it is most likely just individual incompetence and lack of coordination on the Romanian side, and not a sign that something may change in this respect
RO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

IT.evidence: A document outlining the Strengthening the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership was signed in March 2019 between the two states, even though Italy subsequently quit the Belt and Road Initiative and lessened relations with the PRC. TM.evidence: Yes, Turkmenistan has signed an agreement with the People's Republic of China (PRC) to classify their diplomatic relationship as a "Comprehensive Strategic Partnership." The two leaders signed a joint statement and witnessed the signing of several cooperation documents in various areas, including energy, digital economy, green development, culture, sports, and media.

These examples provide clear indications of an agreement between Senegal and the People's Republic of China to elevate their diplomatic ties to a strategic level or beyond.

RU.evidence: Nowadays, Russian-Chinese relations are officially defined by both parties as relations of comprehensive partnership and strategic interaction entering a new era. The basic principles and directions of their development are reflected in the Treaty on Good Neighborliness, Friendship, and Cooperation between the Russian Federation and the People's Republic of China, signed on July 16, 2001. In total, more than 300 intergovernmental treaties and agreements have been concluded, covering practically all areas of cooperation.
RU.note: On March 20, 2023, Chinese President Xi Jinping paid a three-day official visit to Moscow. Following the visit, the heads of Russia and China signed a joint statement on deepening the strategic partnership between the two countries.
RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

NZ.evidence: The PRC and NZ governments signed the agreement for a comprehensive strategic partnership in 2014
NZ.answerer: Answered by Catherine Churchman, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZW.evidence: Zimbabwe and China have many areas of cooperation and they classify their relationship as Strategic Partnership. In 2018, the two countries agreed to establish comprehensive strategic partnership of cooperation. China has vetoed UN security council resolutions on imposing sanctions on Zimbabwe as a result of the partnership.
ZW.answerer: Answered by Nancy Kambudzi and 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Dr. Obert Hodzi

CD.evidence: During president Tshisekedi's visit in China in May 2023, the two countries raised their diplomatic relations to comprehensive strategic cooperative partnership
CD.answerer: Answered by Alfred Bulakali and 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Christian Rumu

MY.evidence: In 2016, Dato’ Sri Mohd Najib Tun Abdul Razak called on H.E. Mr. Xi Jinping, President of the People’s Republic of China, and held talks with H.E. Mr. Li Keqiang, Premier of the State Council. He also met with H.E. Mr. Zhang Dejiang, Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress of China. Both sides had in-depth exchange of views on enhancing China-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, regional and international issues of common interest. During a meeting with Malaysian Supreme Head Sultan Abdullah Sultan Ahmad Shah, Han said China and Malaysia, as friendly neighbors across the sea, enjoy a long history of friendship, and that China will, under the guidance of jointly building a community with a shared future, work with Malaysia in high-quality Belt and Road construction, push forward the implementation of their respective national development plans, and enrich the comprehensive strategic partnership between the two countries.
MY.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PH.evidence: The Joint Action Plan for Strategic Cooperation between the Republic of the Philippines and the People’s Republic of China was signed in Manila on Oct. 29, 2009. During the state visit of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to Beijing upon the invitation of President Xi Jinping in January, “the two leaders underscored the importance of maintaining the good momentum of the bilateral relations, agreed to further strengthen the Philippines-China relationship of Comprehensive Strategic Cooperation under the new circumstances, as close neighbors, kin, and partners that help and understand each other towards win-win results through mutually beneficial cooperation, so as to bring the bilateral relations to new heights.” Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.

TH.evidence:
Thailand is seeking to deepen its relationship with China beyond their existing strategic partnership. Starting in March 2024, Thai passport holders will no longer need a visa to visit China, and the same applies to Chinese citizens visiting Thailand.

On 19 October 2023, Joint Press Communiqué between the Government of the Kingdom of Thailand and the Government of the People’s Republic of China. https://www.mfa.go.th/en/content/jointpresscommuniquethailandandchina

JP.evidence: Japan and China agreed to have a strategic partnership in 2006, which was written down in a joint statement in 2008. It was reportedly based on the Chinese request to reconfirm the importance of the strategic partnership.

DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence: In 2004, the PRC and the UK established a 'comprehensive strategic partnership' (全面战略伙伴关系). The 2015 "UK-China Joint Statement on building a global comprehensive strategic partnership for the 21st Century", by which "The UK and China commit to building a global comprehensive strategic partnership for the 21st Century", is another instance of the indicator phenomenon. These agreements have not been annulled or otherwise shunned by the UK.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence: Australia and China elevated their relationship to the status of 'comprehensive strategic partnership' in 2014. The status has since been brought up in various meetings between Australian and Chinese officials, including at the conclusion of the bilateral FTA talks and the China-Australia annual leaders' meeting in November 2023. However, there is no record of a formal agreement having been signed to recognise this status or to complement it with concrete agreements, making the importance of the status largely symbolic.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: In 2017, Israel and China forged an "Innovative Comprehensive Partnership." It has not been upgraded since.
IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
